question.body: Why is it important to be able to identify the different ligaments of the liver?

multiple_choice.choice: They assist with the immune function of the liver.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The function of these ligaments is to anchor the liver.
Correct. Being able to identify these ligaments assists with indicating anatomic positions.
Incorrect. The immune function of the liver is mostly mediated by the Kupffer cells.
Incorrect. The hepatocytes of the liver neutralize the toxins.
